newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's CNMV lifts Fecsa, Sevillana suspension.
newsitem.headline: Spain's CNMV lifts Fecsa, Sevillana suspension.

text.p: Spain's bourse watchdog CNMV on Tuesday lifted the trading suspension on Fecsa and Sevillana after having barred trading in the shares during two consecutive sessions.
The decision followed a note sent by state-owned electricity firm Endesa on Monday night explaining its planned offer for up to 75 percent of the two smaller companies, announced on Friday.
Endesa has pledged not to buy any shares in Fecsa and Sevillana between now and six months after the publication of the results of its buy offer.
Fecsa and Sevillana had also requested the trading suspension be lifted, a spokesman for the CNMV said.
